item.title: [TINKERPOP-1335] OLAP queries potentially fail for certain match()/select() query patterns
item.description:
There are certain queries that return wrong results when executed via SparkGraphComputer. After testing a few queries I would say that the problematic query pattern is a match() / select() combo.

For example (Grateful Dead graph):

gremlin> g.V().hasLabel("song").match(
             __.as("a").values("name").as("name"),
             __.as("a").values("performances").as("performances")
           ).select("name","performances").count()
==>0

If count() is replaced by program(), the whole thing is going to throw exceptions. However, if we select a instead of name and performances, we get correct result. Likewise, if we remove the select() or just rewrite the match() part, everything works as expected. The simplest query to reproduce the erroneous behavior is this one:

g.V().match(__.as("a").values("name").as("name")).select("name").count()

The tests were done using a real Spark Server. I didn't try to use Spark in local mode or Giraph. I did try TinkerGraphComputer, which worked fine.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you verify that this is broken with GryoInputFormat and not the infrastructure of another graph provider. I note that your stack traces show ids from DSEGraph.

Note that I just confirmed via a test case with GryoInputFormat that the wrong answer is produced by SparkGraphComputer. This is good as now we can isolate this to TinkerPop solely and can test it in our test suite without the need for Spark Server infrastructure.
I can also confirm that this only happens with SparkGraphComputer. Both TinkerGraphComputer and GiraphGraphComputer work as expected.
I have isolated the bug to a problem in SparkStarBarrierInterceptor which is triggered by SparkInterceptorStrategy. Without that strategy engaged, the test passes.

This bug crept up in 3.2.1-SNAPSHOT with the introduction of VertexProgramInterceptors where ComputerAwareSteps should NOT be in onGraphComputer mode. This bug is not found in any official release. The fix was simple:

// in SparkStarBarrierInterceptor
traversal.setStrategies(traversal.clone().getStrategies().removeStrategies(ComputerVerificationStrategy.class)); // no longer a computer job, but parallel standard jobs

We didn't have a test that caught this because it only arises in a super specific, low probability situation. It only happens when you have a ComputerAwareStep that doesn’t do a message pass (star graph local) and ends with a ReducingBarrierStep. Even the MatchTest test I added is a little lame as you would normally just use project() step.
